name: Super Junior-M
description:
'''Super Junior-M''' (an initialism for '''Super Junior-Mandarin''', also known as '''SJ-M'''), is the third sub-unit of the South Korean boy band [[Super Junior]] focusing on [[China|Chinese]] market, currently composed of six Super Junior members [[Lee Sung-min (singer)|Sungmin]], [[Eunhyuk]], [[Choi Si-won|Siwon]], [[Lee Donghae|Donghae]], [[Kim Ryeo-wook|Ryeowook]], [[Cho Kyu-hyun|Kyuhyun]] and special member [[Zhou Mi (singer)|Zhou Mi]]. The sub-unit is known as the first international music group in the [[Chinese language|Chinese]] [[music industry]] to have members of both [[Chinese people|Chinese]] and [[Koreans|Korean]] descent. The sub-unit has released two [[studio album]]s and three [[Extended plays|EP's]] since their debut.

Formed in 2008, Super Junior-M became the third and most successful subgroup branched off from the Korean band [[Super Junior]]. The group was originally composed of seven members: leader [[Han Geng]], [[Lee Donghae|Donghae]], [[Choi Siwon|Siwon]], [[Ryeowook]], [[Kyuhyun]] and two additional members appearing exclusively to the subgroup, [[Zhou Mi (singer)|Zhou Mi]] and [[Henry Lau|Henry]]. In December 2009, Han Geng filed a lawsuit against SM Entertainment and decided to leave the main group and sub-group, resulting in the sub-group's temporary disbandment.

After a year-long hiatus, the group returned with additional Super Junior members [[Eunhyuk]] and [[Lee Sung-min (singer)|Sungmin]], following with the released of their second EP ''[[Perfection (Super Junior-M EP)|Perfection]]'' in February 2011. Following Han Geng's departure, Sungmin was speculations as the new "leader", as he is the oldest member of the team.

Following [[Lee Sung-min (singer)|Sungmin]] military service enlistment in 2015, the sub-unit perform as a 7-member with song titled 'Forever With You' In Special Album [[Devil (Super Junior album)|Devil]]. In April 2018, Special member [[Henry Lau|Henry]] left the sub-unit following his contract expiration with [[SM Entertainment|SM]].
